intro: Oldenlandia parryi, commonly known as the parry's spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, showy flowers. The plant produces white or pale pink flowers that bloom in late summer, often in clusters at the ends of the stems. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Oldenlandia parryi is typically found in rocky soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
